description: Config is the Schema for the configs API

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: ConfigSpec defines the desired state of Config

forceUpgrade.description: ForceUpgrade when set to false, disables the use of the "--force" flag when upgrading the the chart (default: true).

timeout.description:
Timeout specifies the timeout for how long to wait for the chart installation to finish.
A duration string is a sequence of decimal numbers, each with optional fraction and a unit suffix, such as "300ms" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "Âµs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

items.description: Repository describes single repository entry. Fields map to the CLI flags for the "helm add" command

caFile.description: CA bundle file to use when verifying HTTPS-enabled servers.

certFile.description: The TLS certificate file to use for HTTPS client authentication.

insecure.description: Whether to skip TLS certificate checks when connecting to the repository.

keyfile.description: The TLS key file to use for HTTPS client authentication.

roles.description: Roles is the various roles in the cluster.

controller.description: NodeRole is the role of a node in the cluster.

nodeCount.description: NodeCount holds a series of rules for a given node role.

range.description:
NodeRange contains a min and max or only one of them (conflicts
with Values).

max.description: Max is the maximum number of nodes.

min.description: Min is the minimum number of nodes.

values.description: Values holds a list of allowed node counts.

items.description: NodeRole is the role of a node in the cluster.

nodeCount.description: NodeCount holds a series of rules for a given node role.

range.description:
NodeRange contains a min and max or only one of them (conflicts
with Values).

max.description: Max is the maximum number of nodes.

min.description: Min is the minimum number of nodes.

values.description: Values holds a list of allowed node counts.

unsupportedOverrides.description:
UnsupportedOverrides holds the config overrides used to configure
the cluster.

builtInExtensions.description:
BuiltInExtensions holds overrides for the default add-ons we ship
with Embedded Cluster.

items.description: BuiltInExtension holds the override for a built-in extension (add-on).

name.description: The name of the helm chart to override values of, for instance `openebs`.

values.description:
YAML-formatted helm values that will override those provided to the
chart by Embedded Cluster. Properties are overridden individually -
setting a new value for `images.tag` here will not prevent Embedded
Cluster from setting `images.pullPolicy = IfNotPresent`, for example.

k0s.description:
K0s holds the overrides used to configure k0s. These overrides
are merged on top of the default k0s configuration. As the data
layout inside this configuration is very dynamic we have chosen
to use a string here.

v2Enabled.description:
V2Enabled is a temporary property that can be used to opt-in to the new installer. If set,
in addition to using the new v2 install method, v1 installations will be migrated to v2 on
upgrade. This property will be removed once the new installer is fully implemented and the
old installer is removed.

name.description: String; name to use as profile selector for the worker process

status.description: ConfigStatus defines the observed state of Config
